intro: Lychnis parryi, commonly known as Parry's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its flowers are pink to red in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
